message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.CY, cs.DS

The paper presents a new code-based signature scheme that achieves existential unforgeability under adaptive chosen message attacks. This falls under the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR). The scheme uses ternary generalized codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also mentions rejection sampling, which is a technique used in computational complexity (cs.CC). The use of coding theory assumptions is also relevant to the category of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the efficiency of the scheme, which could be relevant to the category of computer systems and networking (cs.CY).
